element.name: Tundra Dwarf
element.source: Benevolent Evil; The Elements and Beyond

description.p: As a tundra dwarf, you are shaped by howling winds, frozen stone, and endless white horizons. Your people carve their halls into permafrost and glacier rock, relying on hard-won caution, patience, and the shared warmth of the clan to survive.
If you’re a dwarf from the polar reaches or high frozen plateaus, you have this subrace, with the following traits.
Ability Score Increase. Your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Arctic Endurance. You have resistance to cold damage. In addition, you are naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in the Dungeon Master’s Guide.

Tundra Survivalist. You gain proficiency in the Survival skill. When you make a Wisdom (Survival) check related to tracking, navigating, or foraging in arctic or snowy environments, you can add double your proficiency bonus instead of your normal proficiency bonus.
Surefooted on Ice. You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone or moved against your will while you are standing on ice or snow.
